VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
Mott Children Residence had 11 special investigations during this inspection review
period. 6 of the 11 special investigations required corrective action plans.
Corrective action plans are monitored for a minimum of six months after the
acceptance of the corrective action plan by Department of Child Welfare Licensing.
Mott Children Residence submitted 6 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP)
during this licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
2022C0325021
Cited R 400.4126, R 400.152 (f), and R 400.4112.
Staff were retrained in safety plan supervision of youths and not moving youths to
other agencies under Whaley Children Center without proper authorization. Issues
of staff not following safety plans and youths moving to other Whaley Children
Center agencies without authorization have not occurred for 6 months. CAP
compliance is achieved. The primary staff involved in this incident resigned.
2022C0103024
Cited R 400.4158 (1)(a)(ii).
Staff were retrained in Therapeutic Crisis Intervention. This was verified through
training documentation. CAP compliance is achieved. The primary staff involved in
this incident resigned.
2022C0217060
Cited R 400.4126.
Staff were retrained in line of sight supervision. CAP is still monitored by
Department of Child Welfare Licensing. The primary staff involved in this incident
resigned.
2022C0325036
Cited R 400.4158 (1)(a)(ii), R 400.4109 (1)(c), and R 400.4112.
Staff were retrained in Therapuetic Crisis Intervention authorized restraint
techniques, incident report and mandated reporting. Incident report writing,
mandated reporting and authroized restraint techniques are reviewed during team
meetings. CAP is monitored by Department of Child Welfare Licensing. The two
main staff involved in this incident were terminated.
3

2023C000058
Cited R 400.4158 (1)(a)(ii) and R 400.4112.
Staff are trained at least twice a calendar year in Therapuetic Crisis Intervention.
Restraint techniques are discussed during team meetings. CAP is monitored by
Department of Child Welfare Licensing. The primary staff involved in this incident
was terminated.
2023C0217003
Cited R 400.4109 (1)(c), R 400.4127 (4) and R 400.4112.
Staff were trained in the use of updated room monitoring sheets and retrained in
variable interval eye-on checks of youths outside of direct supervision. Updated
room monitoring form was reviewed and approved. Room monitoring checks are
discussed at team meetings. CAP is monitored by Department of Child Welfare
Licensing. The staff placed on administrative leave during this investigation was
approved by Department of Child Welfare Licensing to return to direct care worker
status.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns based on the review of Whaley Children's Center -
Mott Children Residence budget and financial audit dated December 31, 2021 and
2020.
PREA compliance
Not applicable.
Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief Administrator Assessment report dated April 6, 2023 was reviewed. Chief
administrator and Mott Children Residence leadership team found compliance with
licensing rules, contract, and corrective action plans. Mott Children Residence
continues to utilize trauma informed care and practices. Mott Children Residence
made the required changes for Qualified Residential Treatment Program
certification. Mott Children Residence is accredited through CARF.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff were interviewed on April 12, 2023. Staff did not report any concerns or
training needs. Youths were interviewed on April 12, 2023. Youths reported feeling
safe and did not report any concerns.
4

Description of Agency Walk Through
An on-site inspection and walk through of Whaley Children's Center administrative
building and Mott Children Residence occurred on April 12, 2023. There are no
issues or safety concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
